metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8806 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
dict.c in libxml2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via an unexpected character immediately after the "<!DOCTYPE html" substring in a crafted HTML document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
libxml2-utils - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
python-libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is a dupe of CVE-2016-1839

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8').
